name: Mute Crimson+
description: Be a ninja and go on an action platforming adventure to save the world. Climb walls, slice up bad guys, master tricky platforming sequences and face ruthless bosses.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8, 10 Processor: 1.5GHz Intel/AMD CPU Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 2.0 compliant video card Storage: 300 MB available space

reviews.review_text: An excellent & addictive challenge - one of those games where you will get caught in the trap 'I really need to go to bed, but I wanna try this level just one last time...' This game isn't overloaded with flash and options, it's all about solid and strong design, bolstered by perfect-tuned graphics and audio. I'm a fan of the developer's other work so there was a lot to look forward to and I am not disappointed in the least! Great job guys, can't wait to see what is next-
A challenging game with extremely gratifying controls and awesome music. The later levels are where this game really shines.

This game is easily one of the best platformers I have ever played.  Fantastic level design, tight controls, increasing difficulty, and exciting boss fights are what makes this game great. If you like platformers and enjoy a good challenge, you will like this game. for sure.  I am looking forward to the next games of this developer!

Mute Crimson+ is an 8 Bit style platformer with a great art style. Everything is black, white and crimson. The game has a great sense of humor as it likes to poke fun at grandmaticalyly incorrect cutscenes that you would often see back in the era of 8 bit. The gameplay is pretty nice. Its fast and demands alot of attention. Did I mention you can chop dogs in half? Pretty cool. Its not worth its full price but if it ever goes on sale you should jump right on it.
Old school ninja platforming action fans will enjoy. I know it be exact.

Fantastically designed platform game. Nothing impossible, though some parts are incredibly challenging. My only complaint is that your ninja REALLY loves to grab ahold of walls, and it becomes a pain to drop off of them. This will cause a TON of frustration and unnecessary deaths (luckily you get unlimited lives).
Modern NES perfection! Buy buy buy.
